content.text: A pendulum is set in motion and timed. The time measured for 20 complete swings is
What is the time for one complete swing of the pendulum?
Two stones of different weight fall at the same time from a table. Air resistance may be ignored
What will happen and why?

table.html:
what will happenwhy
Aboth stones hit the floor at the same timeacceleration of free fall is constant
Bboth stones hit the floor at the same timethey fall at constant speed
Cthe heavier stone hits the floor firstacceleration increases with weight
Dthe heavier stone hits the floor firstspeed increases with weight

content.text: The speed-time graph shown is for a bus travelling between stops
Where on the graph is the acceleration of the bus greatest?
It shows that the masses are equal and the weights are equal
It shows that the masses are equal, but the weights might be different
It shows that the masses might be different and the weights might be different
It shows that the weights are equal, but the masses might be different
A large bag of feathers and a steel block balance each other on some scales
What does this show about the masses and the weights of the bag of feathers and the steel block?
Which row identifies quantities that are measured in newtons?
A liquid has a density of \(0.80 \text{g} /\text{cm}^3\)
Which could be the volume and mass of this liquid?
The diagram shows sections of four objects of equal mass. The position of the center of each object has been marked with a cross
Which object is the most stable?
A large parcel is on a horizontal conveyor belt. The conveyor belt moves the parcel towards a lorry
The parcel travels towards the lorry at a constant speed. Only two horizontal forces act on the parcel: air resistance, and friction with the conveyor belt
Which row correctly compares the directions and the sizes of these two forces?
chemical energy
electrical energy
gravitational energy
thermal (heat) energy
A power station uses nuclear fission to obtain energy
In this process, nuclear energy is **first** changed into
the height of the platform above the ground
the number of boxes lifted
the time taken to lift the boxes
the weight of the boxes
A person lifts boxes of equal weight on to a platform
Which quantity will **not** affect the work done by the person?
A skier walks from the bottom of a ski slope to the top and gains 10 000 J of gravitational potential energy
She skis down the slope. At the bottom of the slope, her kinetic energy is 2000 J
How much energy was converted into thermal energy and sound energy as the skier moved down the slope?
25 cm
75 cm
80 cm
100 cm
The diagram shows a mercury barometer
Which distance is used to calculate the pressure of the atmosphere?
The force on X equals the force on Y
The force on X is less than the force on Y
The pressure on X equals the pressure on Y
The pressure on X is less than the pressure on Y

A dam across a lake is divided into two sections by a rock. Section X is longer than section Y but the two sections are otherwise identical. The water in the lake by the dam is the same depth everywhere. The diagram shows a view from above of the lake and the dam
The water creates a force on each section of the dam and a pressure on each section of the dam
Which statement is correct?
A car tyre contains a constant volume of air
During use, the air gets hotter and the air pressure increases
What explains this increase in pressure in terms of the motion of air molecules?

table.html:
number of air molecules in tyreforce between air molecules and tyre wallnumber of collisions per second between air molecules and tyre wall
Aincreasedincreaseddecreased
Bincreasedunchangeddecreased
Cunchangedincreasedincreased
Dunchangedunchangedincreased

content.text: The table lists the melting points and the boiling points of four different substances
Which substance is a liquid at \(0^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\) ?
A student wishes to calibrate a mercury-in-glass thermometer with a \(^\circ \mathrm{C}\) scale
Which values should she use for the lower fixed point and for the upper fixed point?

table.html:
lower fixed pointupper fixed point
Afreezing point of mercuryboiling point of mercury
Bfreezing point of mercuryboiling point of water
Cfreezing point of waterboiling point of mercury
Dfreezing point of waterboiling point of water

content.text: The graph shows the temperature of a substance as it is heated steadily
In which part of the graph is the substance boiling?
Four blocks, made from different materials, are each heated so that they have the same increase in internal energy
Which block has the smallest thermal capacity?

Which diagram shows how warm air near the heater moves because of convection in the
A double-glazed window consists of two panes of glass with a vacuum between them
The vacuum reduces the amount of thermal energy transferred through the window
Which row shows how much thermal energy is transferred through the vacuum by conduction, by convection and by radiation?
The diagram shows a water wave in a ripple tank
Which line represents a wavefront?
They travel as longitudinal waves
They travel at the same speed as sound waves
They travel by means of molecular vibration
They can travel through a vacuum
Which statement about radio waves is correct?
The converging lens in a camera is used to make an image on a film
At which labelled point could a large object be placed so that it makes a smaller image?
It is completely reflected
It is completely refracted
It is partially reflected and partially refracted
It is refracted at an angle of refraction of \(90^{\circ}\)
A ray of light in water is incident on the surface. The angle of incidence is much smaller than the critical angle
What happens to this ray?
Sound waves may cause an echo
What happens to sound waves to cause an echo and what is the nature of sound waves?

table.html:
what an echo is caused bynature of sound waves
Areflectionlongitudinal
Breflectiontransverse
Crefractionlongitudinal
Drefractiontransverse

content.text: In a test, a car horn is found to be too loud and the pitch of the note is too high
What information does this give about the amplitude and the frequency of the sound produced?

table.html:
amplitudefrequency
Atoo largetoo large
Btoo largetoo small
Ctoo smalltoo large
Dtoo smalltoo small
